description: Numbers n such that n^2 has initial digit '9'.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: id9[n_]:=Module[{min=Floor[Sqrt[9*10^n]],max=Floor[Sqrt[10*10^n]]}, Select[ Range[ min,max], First[IntegerDigits[#^2]]==9&]]; Flatten[ Table[ id9[n],{n,0,5}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 29 2013 *)
author: _Jeff Burch_
